As long as you have Python installed, you can run it directly from the command line in two different ways.

You can type in the command python which will give you an interactive shell which you can run scripts from inside, or you can save files in a text editor with the extension .py and then run the command python script.py, it will execute the script.

You can also use a variety of IDEâ€™s to run Python, the recommended one is PyCharm which is published by JetBrains.

Note: When developing Python scripts, be aware of the version you are using, there is Python 2 and Python 3. Aside from syntax differences, you also have to use the command python3 to initiate the shell, and to run Python 3 scripts. If you do not do that, it calls the wrong interpreter and could lead to errors in its execution.
